Part D: ArXiv.org - Preprint archive for research dissemination

About arXiv.org
Open-access research platform: arXiv.org hosts over two million scholarly articles across eight subject areas.
Pioneer in digital scholarship: Founded by Paul Ginsparg in 1991, maintained by Cornell Tech.
Fields covered: Physics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Quantitative Biology, Quantitative Finance, Statistics, Electrical Engineering & Systems Science, and Economics.
Services for researchers: Article submission, retrieval, search & discovery, web distribution, API access, content curation, and preservation.
Moderation process: Submissions are checked for topical relevance and scholarly value; material is not peer-reviewed.
Community and governance: Curated by volunteer moderators and guided by arXiv Leadership Team and advisory councils.
Free submission: Registered users may submit articles without fees.

arXiv.org

articles.title: JOPSCIP Workshop
articles.description: Digital Solutions for Research and E-portfolio!
articles.contents:
Welcome to JOPSCIP Workshop
Digital Solutions for Research and E-portfolio
This workshop provides comprehensive training and resources for modern research methodologies and digital portfolio development. Our expert facilitators bring extensive experience in academic research and digital innovation.
Meet Our Team



Temur Gugushvili

Associate Professor

IBSU & SCIEN

___

Google Scholar




Workshop Sessions:
Digital Identity: Building Your Digital Academic Identity
Project Management: Research Project Management & Communication
Literature Organization: Reference Management & Literature Organization
Data Handling: Data Collection and Analysis & AI-Enhanced
Literature Review
Getting Started
Ready to enhance your research capabilities? Explore our workshop Day 1 & Day 2 materials and connect with our team for personalized guidance on your digital research journey.
For questions or additional information, please contact on following email tgugushvili[at]ibsu.edu.ge, gvantsa.salukvadze[at]tsu.ge
